data.text: Lightweight Bikepacking Shoes, Breathable and SPD Compatible

Edit: Ok i bought ride concept tallac clip..thanks for help Bikepacking shoes ? Hi. I am looking for bikepacking shoes for my long trip to Africa.. With: 1 Breathable mesh 2 wide enough for my wide feet 3 light for long hot biking days 4 for automatic pedals .spd Thanks for help
You mean breathable mesh ? I used the Specialized Tahoe mtb shoes a few years and I was quite happy I must say !

data.text: yess meshh
data.author: Samy Jousse

data.text: Try to find shoes with laces. Easier to repair on road than boa.
data.author: Tapio Suorsa

data.text: Laces also give a better and more adaptable fit too .
data.author: Jeremy Lawrence

data.text: I just go with comfy sneakers and flat pedals. I may be slightly less efficient, but I'm comfortable and my feet don't hurt.
data.author: Matthew Hall

data.text: Vincent Wheels I probably lose a little because bike shoes have stiff soles and sneakers are squishy, but in general, I agree with you, and comfort goes a long way.
data.author: Matthew Hall

data.text: Vincent, yes it is definitely less efficient because you are using fewer muscles to do same job. Cycling with flats when you know how to use clipless better is so much harder.
data.author: Jeremy Lawrence

data.text: Clipless allows you to use more inefficient motions, but isn't otherwise any more efficient on steady flat ground.
data.author: Leif Warner

data.text: Sorry but what made up nonsense is that ?
data.author: Jeremy Lawrence

data.text:
You're perfectly capable of looking up the science/ testing behind this yourself. Here's a link if you wish. https://pedalinginnovations.com/does-this-video-really-prove-that-flats-are-more-efficient-than-clipless-pedals/

data.text: Recently got a pair of the Ride Concepts Tallacs flats and love them. Some of the most comfortable shoes I own and great on pedals. They also offer a version for clips and I am tempted by those for my gravel rides.

data.text: Photo is of Bontrager Avert shoes, which I have been using. Basically hiking shoes with cleat attachment. Great on & off the bike. I bit hard to dry once wet, like any hiking shoe would be

data.text: Giro Rumbles. Broad across widest part of foot, breathable mesh and if you use waterproof socks then they can be three season shoes. I can wear them all day on or off bike. Though like with any shoe I wear, I use Sorbothane double strike insoles as they make so much differnce to comfort.
